content.html: This could break with older versions, but that is okay. We do not promise compatibility between different major versions.

pullrequest.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

content.raw:
We can definitely do it, but I'm not sure if it will be backwards compatible with older versions of `ign-transport` (I'd have to learn more about ZeroMQ to be certain).

Do we know if adding a new field to the end of a ZeroMQ `message_t` is safe? Will older versions of `ign-transport` just happily ignore the new field? If so, then we can just go ahead and add it.
content.html:
We can definitely do it, but I'm not sure if it will be backwards compatible with older versions of ign-transport (I'd have to learn more about ZeroMQ to be certain).

Do we know if adding a new field to the end of a ZeroMQ message_t is safe? Will older versions of ign-transport just happily ignore the new field? If so, then we can just go ahead and add it.

pull_request.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

pullrequest.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

content.raw: The earlier time received is set the better. One thing to keep in mind is record and playback need time from a monotonic clock. Otherwise the time between messages will be wrong if the time changes due to leap seconds, daylight savings, etc. In a528614 the record proof-of-concept saves the difference between system and steady clocks at the start of the program, then uses steady clock when messages are received.
content.html: The earlier time received is set the better. One thing to keep in mind is record and playback need time from a monotonic clock. Otherwise the time between messages will be wrong if the time changes due to leap seconds, daylight savings, etc. In a528614 the record proof-of-concept saves the difference between system and steady clocks at the start of the program, then uses steady clock when messages are received.

content.raw: We could send the "sent" timestamp over the wire, in the same way we send the topic name.
content.html: We could send the "sent" timestamp over the wire, in the same way we send the topic name.

pull_request.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

pullrequest.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

content.raw: I think `MessageInfo` would also be an ideal place to set the timestamp of when the message was sent; the only complicating factor is that for remote subscribers, we'll need to transmit that timestamp over the wire. With the current design of `ign-transport`, making that change wouldn't be backwards compatible with older versions of the `ign-transport` library, so all subscribers/publishers would have to agree on which version of `ign-transport` they're using.
content.html: I think MessageInfo would also be an ideal place to set the timestamp of when the message was sent; the only complicating factor is that for remote subscribers, we'll need to transmit that timestamp over the wire. With the current design of ign-transport, making that change wouldn't be backwards compatible with older versions of the ign-transport library, so all subscribers/publishers would have to agree on which version of ign-transport they're using.

pull_request.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

update.description:
This pull request adds the message type name and topic partition to the `MessageInfo` class. This info previously was not be available to a subscriber using the generic protobuf message interface.

@caguero This strips the leading `@/` and trailing `@` from the partition before putting it into the info class. Where did the leading `/` come from? Is it important?
update.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

pull_request.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

pullrequest.title: Add Type and Partition to MessageInfo

content.raw:
@sloretz , when advertising a topic, the fully qualified topic is composed using the partition, namespace and topic. See [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/eac9336a638f193ec0c71d79666c261f9f1a7e11/src/TopicUtils.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#TopicUtils.cc-68).

A partition starting with `/` or without should be equivalent because it will be added internally if needed. The partition part and the namespace+topic are always similar to absolute paths. That's why you see them with a `/`. I would leave the `/` when setting the partition to be consistent with the value returned by `Topic()`. We're always returning the topic with the `/`.
content.html:
@sloretz , when advertising a topic, the fully qualified topic is composed using the partition, namespace and topic. See here.

A partition starting with / or without should be equivalent because it will be added internally if needed. The partition part and the namespace+topic are always similar to absolute paths. That's why you see them with a /. I would leave the / when setting the partition to be consistent with the value returned by Topic(). We're always returning the topic with the /.
